subject: Re: OT: Usenet services
body:
I happen to be a fin of Easynews.  I've been with them since something
like Fall of 2001 or so.  I pay $9.98 per month and my download quota is
in the gigs; I'll never exceed that in a month.:).  I don't know what
their current rates might be but mine is still down where I said it is.
It has a nice web interface that is accessible to text browsers like
elinks and of course, you can still use newsreaders to use it also.

On Sun, Apr 22, 2007 at 12:03:23PM -0400, Igor Gueths wrote:
> -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
> Hash: SHA512
> 
> Hi all. I'm thinking of perhaps subscribing to one of the various News providers; however, I'm currently stuck as to which one to go with? Currently, my first choice seems to be Giganews, and 
> then perhaps Easynews; anyone have any favorite providers that they use? Giganews seems to be the only service that offers unlimited downloads for something like $24.95; the rest of the ones 
> I've seen will limit your downloading to some number of GB. Thanks.
> - - Igor
